page.title: 03MIXED FARMING IN N-E LEICS.
page.content: The nature of the{terrain}here, being rolling hills and valleys means that not all land is suitable for large scale arable farming methods.Hence the farmers try to optimize their use of the land by{rearing animals}on that land unsuitable for arable use.Where the slope permits however, field boundaries have been removed to make larger more economic units suitable for extensive{cultivation. The nature of mixed farming allows the farmer to spread his workload evenly throughout the year and to minimize the{"risk factor"}inherent in all farming due to climate, disease, etc. Many aspects of mixed farming are {complementary}e.g. animals provide manure for fertiliser and the animals use the surplus straw from cereal cultivation as fodder and litter.
